mws:data.text: html{border: 0px #006699 solid;border-left-width: 15px} body {margin: 15px;padding: 0px;background-color:#ffffff;color:black; font-family:helvetica;font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.4em} div.volume-title {font-size:24pt;text-align:center;font-weight:bold} div.title {font-style:italic;font-weight:bold} div.mathics {font-size:larger;font-weight:bold} span.mathics-zbl {float:right} div.matverw {font-size:smaller} div.review {margin:5mm 5mm 5mm 5mm} div.aunot {font-weight:bold} div.published {font-weight:bold} .number {font-style: italic; text-align:right} div.reviewer{font-style:italic;text-align:right} EN 05C78 math1 -labeling; outerplanar graphs; math2 -number serial article Li, Xiangwen; Zhou, Sanming Number: 6109944 Labeling outerplanar graphs with maximum degree three. 2013 Summary: An math3 -labeling of a graph math4 is an assignment of a non-negative integer to each vertex of math5 such that adjacent vertices receive integers that differ by at least two and vertices at distance two receive distinct integers. The span of such a labeling is the difference between the largest and smallest integers used. The math6 -number of math7 , denoted by math8 , is the minimum span over all math9 -labelings of math10 . Bodlaender et al. conjectured that if math11 is an outerplanar graph of maximum degree math12 , then math13 . Calamoneri and Petreschi proved that this conjecture is true when math14 but false when math15 . Meanwhile, they proved that math16 for any outerplanar graph G with math17 and asked whether or not this bound is sharp. In this paper we answer this question by proving that math18 for every outerplanar graph with maximum degree math19 . We also show that this bound math20 can be achieved by infinitely many outerplanar graphs with math21 .

<m:math xmlns="http://zentralblatt.org" alttext="\lambda(G)\leq\Delta+2" xml:id="m13.1" display="inline" xref="m13.1.cmml"><m:semantics xml:id="m13.1a" xref="m13.1.cmml"><m:mrow xml:id="m13.1.9" xref="m13.1.9.cmml"><m:mrow xml:id="m13.1.9.1" xref="m13.1.9.1.cmml"><m:mi xml:id="m13.1.1" xref="m13.1.1.cmml">λ</m:mi><m:mo xml:id="m13.1.9.1.1" xref="m13.1.9.1.1.cmml">⁢</m:mo><m:mrow xml:id="m13.1.3" xref="m13.1.3.cmml"><m:mo xml:id="m13.1.3a" xref="m13.1.3.cmml">(</m:mo><m:mi xml:id="m13.1.3b" xref="m13.1.3.cmml">G</m:mi><m:mo xml:id="m13.1.3c" xref="m13.1.3.cmml">)</m:mo></m:mrow></m:mrow><m:mo xml:id="m13.1.5" xref="m13.1.5.cmml">≤</m:mo><m:mrow xml:id="m13.1.9.2" xref="m13.1.9.2.cmml"><m:mi mathvariant="normal" xml:id="m13.1.6" xref="m13.1.6.cmml">Δ</m:mi><m:mo xml:id="m13.1.7" xref="m13.1.7.cmml">+</m:mo><m:mn xml:id="m13.1.8" xref="m13.1.8.cmml">2</m:mn></m:mrow></m:mrow><m:annotation-xml xml:id="m13.1.cmml" encoding="MathML-Content" xref="m13.1"><m:apply xml:id="m13.1.9.cmml" xref="m13.1.9"><m:leq xml:id="m13.1.5.cmml" xref="m13.1.5"/><m:apply xml:id="m13.1.9.1.cmml" xref="m13.1.9.1"><m:times xml:id="m13.1.9.1.1.cmml" xref="m13.1.9.1.1"/><m:ci xml:id="m13.1.1.cmml" xref="m13.1.1">λ</m:ci><m:ci xml:id="m13.1.3.cmml" xref="m13.1.3">G</m:ci></m:apply><m:apply xml:id="m13.1.9.2.cmml" xref="m13.1.9.2"><m:plus xml:id="m13.1.7.cmml" xref="m13.1.7"/><m:ci xml:id="m13.1.6.cmml" xref="m13.1.6">normal-Δ</m:ci><m:cn type="integer" xml:id="m13.1.8.cmml" xref="m13.1.8">2</m:cn></m:apply></m:apply></m:annotation-xml><m:annotation xml:id="m13.1b" encoding="application/x-tex" xref="m13.1.cmml">\lambda(G)\leq\Delta+2</m:annotation></m:semantics></m:math>

<m:math xmlns="http://zentralblatt.org" alttext="\Delta=3" xml:id="m15.1" display="inline" xref="m15.1.cmml"><m:semantics xml:id="m15.1a" xref="m15.1.cmml"><m:mrow xml:id="m15.1.4" xref="m15.1.4.cmml"><m:mi mathvariant="normal" xml:id="m15.1.1" xref="m15.1.1.cmml">Δ</m:mi><m:mo xml:id="m15.1.2" xref="m15.1.2.cmml">=</m:mo><m:mn xml:id="m15.1.3" xref="m15.1.3.cmml">3</m:mn></m:mrow><m:annotation-xml xml:id="m15.1.cmml" encoding="MathML-Content" xref="m15.1"><m:apply xml:id="m15.1.4.cmml" xref="m15.1.4"><m:eq xml:id="m15.1.2.cmml" xref="m15.1.2"/><m:ci xml:id="m15.1.1.cmml" xref="m15.1.1">normal-Δ</m:ci><m:cn type="integer" xml:id="m15.1.3.cmml" xref="m15.1.3">3</m:cn></m:apply></m:annotation-xml><m:annotation xml:id="m15.1b" encoding="application/x-tex" xref="m15.1.cmml">\Delta=3</m:annotation></m:semantics></m:math>

<m:math xmlns="http://zentralblatt.org" alttext="\lambda(G)\leq\Delta+5" xml:id="m16.1" display="inline" xref="m16.1.cmml"><m:semantics xml:id="m16.1a" xref="m16.1.cmml"><m:mrow xml:id="m16.1.9" xref="m16.1.9.cmml"><m:mrow xml:id="m16.1.9.1" xref="m16.1.9.1.cmml"><m:mi xml:id="m16.1.1" xref="m16.1.1.cmml">λ</m:mi><m:mo xml:id="m16.1.9.1.1" xref="m16.1.9.1.1.cmml">⁢</m:mo><m:mrow xml:id="m16.1.3" xref="m16.1.3.cmml"><m:mo xml:id="m16.1.3a" xref="m16.1.3.cmml">(</m:mo><m:mi xml:id="m16.1.3b" xref="m16.1.3.cmml">G</m:mi><m:mo xml:id="m16.1.3c" xref="m16.1.3.cmml">)</m:mo></m:mrow></m:mrow><m:mo xml:id="m16.1.5" xref="m16.1.5.cmml">≤</m:mo><m:mrow xml:id="m16.1.9.2" xref="m16.1.9.2.cmml"><m:mi mathvariant="normal" xml:id="m16.1.6" xref="m16.1.6.cmml">Δ</m:mi><m:mo xml:id="m16.1.7" xref="m16.1.7.cmml">+</m:mo><m:mn xml:id="m16.1.8" xref="m16.1.8.cmml">5</m:mn></m:mrow></m:mrow><m:annotation-xml xml:id="m16.1.cmml" encoding="MathML-Content" xref="m16.1"><m:apply xml:id="m16.1.9.cmml" xref="m16.1.9"><m:leq xml:id="m16.1.5.cmml" xref="m16.1.5"/><m:apply xml:id="m16.1.9.1.cmml" xref="m16.1.9.1"><m:times xml:id="m16.1.9.1.1.cmml" xref="m16.1.9.1.1"/><m:ci xml:id="m16.1.1.cmml" xref="m16.1.1">λ</m:ci><m:ci xml:id="m16.1.3.cmml" xref="m16.1.3">G</m:ci></m:apply><m:apply xml:id="m16.1.9.2.cmml" xref="m16.1.9.2"><m:plus xml:id="m16.1.7.cmml" xref="m16.1.7"/><m:ci xml:id="m16.1.6.cmml" xref="m16.1.6">normal-Δ</m:ci><m:cn type="integer" xml:id="m16.1.8.cmml" xref="m16.1.8">5</m:cn></m:apply></m:apply></m:annotation-xml><m:annotation xml:id="m16.1b" encoding="application/x-tex" xref="m16.1.cmml">\lambda(G)\leq\Delta+5</m:annotation></m:semantics></m:math>
